Key Match Events: Son Heung-min scored a brace and assisted one goal to help South Korea beat China 3-0
Hwang Hee-chan fell down in the box and the referee awarded the away team a penalty, which was converted by Son with composure
Tan Long was close to find the equalizer for China in the 42nd minute, but his close range shot went off the near post
Three minutes later, Son headed home his second goal from a corner, before the South Korean captain's one-on-one attempt was saved by Chinese goalkeeper Yan Junling
On 86 minutes, Jung Seung-hyun's header went into the back of the net thanks to a precise free kick right cross from Son as South Korea sealed the 3-0 victory
Pre-Game Insights: China rallied to beat Thailand 2-1 in Bangkok, and South Korea thrashed Singapore 5-0 at home in the opening matches of Group C last Thursday
Post-Match Reflections: South Korea showed dominance throughout the match with 65 percent of ball possession and a total of 18 shots, 13 more than the host team
Miscellaneous Highlights: South Korea broke the deadlock just 11 minutes into the match

In the second stage of the Asian qualifying tournament, 36 teams have been divided into nine groups competing in a home-and-away round-robin format. The top two of each group will advance to the third stage
Others: South Korea led the group with two straight wins after the match
